thread.title: 4 crew members, 3 passengers feared dead in Nigerian Air Force jet crash in Kaduna - @Post_Nigeria
thread.title_full: 4 crew members, 3 passengers feared dead in Nigerian Air Force jet crash in Kaduna - @Post_Nigeria

author: Rebecca Bratek
title: 4 crew members, 3 passengers feared dead in Nigerian Air Force jet crash in Kaduna - @Post_Nigeria
text:
View Results Loading ... 
The Chief of Air Staff, Air Marshal Sadique Abubakar, has set up a panel to investigate the circumstances surrounding the crash of Nigerian Air Force, NAF, Dornier-228 aircraft with call sign NAF030 headed by an Air Vice Marshal. 
In a statement issued in Abuja on Saturday by Air Commodore Dele Alonge, the Director of Public Relations and Information, NAF Headquarters, it was revealed that the Chief of Air Staff aborted his official trip to Port Harcourt and would visit the crash site and families of some of the deceased personnel. 
The plane belonging to NAF, crashed Saturday morning at the old Nigeria Defense Academy , NDA, in Kaduna also known as Ribadu Cantonment. 
Four crew members and three passengers died in the incident. 
The statement further revealed the Chief of Air Staff would be accompanied by the Air Officer Commanding Training Command, AVM Alikali Mamu during the visit. 
“A Nigerian Air Force, NAF, Dornier-228 aircraft, with call sign NAF030, has crashed into a house at Ribadu Cantonment, Kaduna. 
“Though no casualty was recorded on ground, there were no survivors among the passengers on board the aircraft,” the statement said. 
It said the aircraft was Abuja bound and had taken-off at about 6.45a.m. from the Kaduna Military Airfield before the mishap.
